root: ^Hey, detective. [She seems shaken, but she still smiles at you as you enter the interrogation room]. What was it you wanted to talk to me about?

s: ^Tell me a little bit about yourself.
^Where were you on the night of Willoughby's murder?
^What do you think of Sam Soapley?
^What do you think of Toby Wilson?

Questions: ^[Her eyes dart around the room, not quite looking at you. She seems as if she's barely keeping it together]. Anything else, Detective?

s: ^Tell me a little bit about yourself.
^Where were you on the night of Willoughby's murder?
^What do you think of Sam Soapley?
^What do you think of Toby Wilson?

Self: ^Me? Well.... I'm Mr. Willoughby's secretary! That means I take all his phone calls and help keep his papers all in order... though I guess I won't be doing any more of that anymore.... [She looks distraught, for a moment, before the smile flutters back onto her face, nervously].

c-0: ^[Her smile is as dazzling as a crystal chandelier]. Thank you, Detective. That made me feel a bit better.
c-1: ^Oh... I'm afraid it's all a sham, a sham. You have to keep a smile on your face even when dealing with tough customers... it's second nature now, I'm afraid.

s: ^Difficult customers? Did anyone specific spring to mind?

c-0: ^Specific? No, no, not really. Just sometimes his clients... well, you know he's a lawyer. Was a lawyer, I mean. Sometimes people don't like the fees he charges them or the job he's done... so they call him about it and I have to deal with them. [She twists the wedding ring around her finger nervously].

^[She shrinks uncomfortably as you continue your line of questioning]. Well, I mean, I guess there is one customer who has been very difficult recently. [She looks around the room, as if trying to catch eavesdroppers in every shadow].
^It's... well. Toby. Don't tell him I said that, please.

s: ^"What was it that made him so difficult?"
^"Don't worry, your secret's safe with me."
^I'd never tell on a woman like you. (flirt)

c-2: ^[She blushes gratefully]. Thank you, Detective. I knew I could count on you.
c-3: ^[She blushes gratefully]. Thank you, Detective. I knew I could count on you.

s: ^Ask her what made Toby so difficult.
^Ask her why she hesistated in telling you about Toby.

Difficult: ^Oh, you know... he's on trial for some murder of his wife or something... it's a tough case to defend, you know. The evidence is stacked against him... and Mr. Willoughby would always complain about the case to me when I stayed late in the office. He wanted to raise Mr. Wilson's legal fees because it's been such a horrible job to work for him, and he called several times about that, all angry and everything.... [she shudders at the memory].

s: ^Would he kill Mr. Willoughby over it?

c-0: ^[A bitterness, the kind brought about by a more personal grudge, seeps into her voice]. I wouldn't put it past him.

Hesitate: ^He's on trial for murdering his wife... what would he do to me if he knew I insulted him? [She fidgets with the ring again].
Ring: ^Oh, this silly little thing? [She giggles nervously]. I am married, you see to Max Winters, he's a pharmacist, you see...

c-0: ^[You remember that Mr. Willoughby was poisoned. Perhaps you should ask her about it].

s: ^Assure her being married doesn't mean anything for the two of you. (flirt)

c-0: ^[She giggles and flicks her tail coyly]. Well, Officer, that's nice to hear...

Poison: ^Oh, am I familiar with poisons? No... that's more my husband's area... I don't really pay attention to all that medical stuff... he takes care of it all for me. I do the finances!

c-1: ^No, that's more my husband's thing. And we hire a maid.

Money: ^Our finances? [She seems surprised, but then it dawns on her]. Oh, all dandy, swell... still are, though maybe less so now that I'm out of a job... I wouldn't kill him for money, Detective. Do you really think so little of me?

s: ^So you would kill him for other reasons, then?
^I of course believe a beautiful dame like you. (flirt)
^Ask her if she would kill him for other reasons.

c-2: ^[She blushes]. Oh, why thank you, Detective.

s: ^Ask her if she would kill him for other reasons.

Kill: ^No! Of course not. I wouldn't and didn't kill him! [She clutches her chest in shock].
Alibi: ^Well, I got off my shift at 5... commuted home... was stuck in awful traffic. So I didn't get home until around six, and me and my husband don't have any kids, so I just watched television until about seven, and then Miranda - that's my neighbor-friend, you see, I call her neighbor-friend because she's my neighbor and my friend...

^Well, she heard I was feeling down so she came over to check on me! So we hung out and then we decided to go to the bar across from Mr. Willoughby's office, and I didn't really want to go, because I was worried about Toby, since he's been skulking around there trying to talk to... us about the legal fees... and I didn't want to run into him.

^But we went to the bar, listened to some jazz - that's why Miranda wanted to take me there, we love jazz... and we got out on the street around 11 o'clock and then there were all the police cars and I ran over to see what was happening and suddenly I was in police custody!

s: ^How can I be sure you're telling the truth?

c-0: ^Yes... oh... no... do you think he...?
c-1: ^[She hands you a ticket to the jazz show at the bar]. See?

c-0: ^Yes... oh... no... do you think he...?

Enemies: ^Enemies? Certainly. I mean, he was a defense attorney... he'd get all sorts of angry letters sent from people all the time... especially when he defended that high profile mobster that one time... Oh, the death threats were awful.

s: ^Do you think he could have been killed by a note sender?
^Ask her if there's anyone specific who disliked him.

c-0: ^Oh, no, those dried up years ago... it's kind of odd... almost as if someone's telling him which are the best cases to take up...

s: ^Ask her if there's anyone else who dislikes him.

Specific: ^Well, recently, I'd almost say... [She lowers her voice]. Can you keep a secret?
Secret: ^Toby. He's been skulking around outside, too... almost watching. Yelling at Mr. Willoughby whenever he can about the fees or something... being rough with me when he can... I think he's a terribly unstable man.

c-0: ^Oh, I don't know... they say he killed his wife, and I believe them... he seems sly and calculated but he's prone to rages like you wouldn't believe... a real piece of work.

Willoughby: ^Willoughby... oh... a fine boss, and a fine man, too, I think. I didn't know him that well... he was distant as a boss, if kind. I think he thought I was incompetent... going on about my typist skills... it's these damn claws! I grew them out too far.

s: ^Ask her if she'd kill him if he fired her.
^Ask her more about his leadership style.
^Ask her if he knew her on a personal level.
^Ask her if she liked her job.

Fire: ^Of course not! I'd find another job... or finally crawl home and start a family... children, white picket fences... the whole deal... no. I'd never be a Jones.

c-1: ^[She blushes]. Well, that I am... Maybe I'd even go to school and become a lawyer. How unseemly!

Leader: ^A charismatic sort, but he mostly told me what to do. Though sometimes he would confide in me the details of the cases... that's why I know so much about Toby's... and I don't know if that's normal, but he'd also talk about making me take typing lessons which is why I thought he was angry at me and... oh, I'm rambling, aren't I?
TC: ^He murdered his wife... alledgedly... by poison! Lillies in her evening tea! Took out a life insurance policy and everything! Just like one of those crime films.
Personal: ^Oh, he had dinner with me and my husband once or twice early on... but we just sort of dropped the habit. I don't think he or Sam like my husband very much.

c-0: ^Oh, I don't know... I guess he isn't a very good conversationalist, Max...
c-1: ^No, we didn't really know each other on a personal level.

Job: ^Oh, it's fine, I suppose. Nothing too glamorous, but I enjoy it... enjoyed it, I suppose... it's all over now.

s: ^I could help you with a job.

c-0: ^Oh, I'm sure I'll do fine on my own.

Pay: ^Oh, he paid enough, probably more than it. Our finances are taking a substantial hit now that he's gone...
Sam: ^Sam... I've known him a long time. He's a dependable guy, really. Good at what he does. Makes the best Manhattan I've ever had! And keeps a cute little garden, too...

s: ^What was his relationship with Willoughby like?
^Did he grow anything poisonous in the garden?

Sillow: ^Oh... really sweet. I didn't spend too much time around the two of them, but I always got the impression that the old man had taken Mr. Willoughby under his wing... like a son...

c-0: ^Well, now that you mention it, I heard them yelling about something the other night... I didn't catch many words but it had something to do money...

s: ^Do you think Sam could have killed Mr. Willoughby over it?

c-0: ^Oh, maybe... they seemed right as rain the next day - I left before they stopped arguing, see... it was soooo awkward, but you never know what hides behind the facade...

Garden: ^Oh, I really wouldn't know... I don't know much about flowers.

s: ^Did he know a lot about them?

c-0: ^Poisonous ones, you mean? No... I mean, maybe? I really didn't know the man that well, I'm sorry.

Smob: ^Oh, as far as I could tell, yes. This place has always been spic and span... if that's what a butler even does.
Toby: ^Toby, Toby, Toby... [She twitches her tail, avoiding eye contact]. I don't know what to say!

s: ^I heard he's on trial for the murder of his wife.
^What was his relationship to Mr. Willoughby?

c-2: ^Well? No... not at all... [She blushes and looks away, riddling with the ring all the while].

Trial2: ^[She stumbles over the words]. On trial for murdering his wife...

c-0: ^Yes... yes. It's true. Mr. Willoughby's defending him, you know. A tough case.
^He's on trial for murdering his wife... what would he do to me if he knew I insulted him? [She fidgets with the ring again].
c-1: ^Well, you know, all the evidence is stacked up against him! He has no alibi for the night of her disappearance that anyone can confirm, and she was poisoned and everyone knows Toby- Mr. Wilson - knew a lot about poisons from the army! He had badges specializing in them and everything... or maybe I'm thinking of the boy scouts.

c-0: ^In fact, it was so stressful that Mr. Willoughby was thinking of increasing his fees for all the headache... it's not like he'd win, anyway. He may be a good lawyer, Mr. Willoughby, but he's not that good of a lawyer.

s: ^Why would Willoughby take up the case?

c-0: ^Well, I don't know... maybe... [She sighs, almost dreamily].

s: ^Offer to get her mind off it. (flirt).
^Offer to keep her thoughts a secret.

c-1: ^He needed the money... you know, I think he was even thinking of letting me go because he needed the money so terribly. The only person he'd never let go is Sam...

s: ^Would you kill him so you wouldn't be fired?

c-1: ^How would that help me? Of course not!

Dreamy: ^It's, well, it's nothing! [She blushes furiously]. It's just... well, he is rather charming, isn't he?

c-0: ^That's easy for you to say, Detective. You don't know him like I do! [She clamps a hand over her mouth, realizing she's said too much].
^Not anything serious... [She blusters for a moment, before cracking].

c-1: ^Finally somebody that appreciates his charms as much as I do! Even if he did kill his wife, I'd take the chance to get to know him better. [She clamps a head over her mouth, realizing she's said too much].

c-0: ^Not anything serious... [She blusters for a moment, before cracking].

c-2: ^Not anything serious... [She twists the wedding ring more aggressively now].

TobyLove: ^Fine, fine, yes, I had feelings for him! Just a tiny little crush. A little crush that snowballed into a big one... my husband and I have been having a tough time, you know. He wants children but I don't want to give up being a working woman... but it never went so far as to be physical!

s: ^I respect women and don't murder my wives. (flirt)

c-1: ^Isn't that the bare minimum? But you are sweet, Detective... if clumsy.

s: ^Ask her if she's sure she wasn't having an affair with Toby.

Affair: ^Fine, we were together. I just didn't want to tell you because... [here she lowers her voice]... well, I think Mr. Willoughby saw us. And I told Toby I thought he saw us and that we needed to break things off and now I'm worried that if I say that you'll think I tried to kill Mr. Willoughby to keep it a secret!
^[Her chest heaves with the weight of her confession. A great relief passes over her].

s: ^That sounds an awful lot like a confession.
^Do you think Toby would throw you under the bus to cover himself?

c-0: ^No! No! It isn't I swear. I would never kill Mr. Willoughby - and it may seem like I have a lot of reasons to, but I never would. He was a tricky fellow, Mr. Willoughby, but I'm no killer!
^Has Toby been telling you things about me? Oh! Is this his revenge?

s: ^Ask her why you should believe her.

c-0: ^Thank you, I knew you would... or well, I didn't... but... isn't it funny how you feel so nervous when you know you have nothing to hide?

c-1: ^[She nods]. I think Toby would do anything to get back at me for breaking things off with him. Maybe framing me for murder would be one of them. Please don't send me to jail, Detective! I wouldn't kill Mr. Willoughby.
^Thank you, I knew you would... or well, I didn't... but... isn't it funny how you feel so nervous when you know you have nothing to hide?

BelieveMe: ^If Mr. Willoughby did anything with our affair, it would be to blackmail us, and I can afford it. And even if the whole thing came out into the open, I would rather live in scandal than with blood on my paws. Please! Believe me. Oh, this is my worst nightmare.

c-0: ^I mean, you're just covering your bases... [She still looks frazzled from the ordeal].

Reputation: ^Oh, uh, I don't know... I don't really want to talk about him.

c-0: ^The whole wife murder thing... [She looks at you intently with round amber eyes]. Detective. You can keep a secret, can't you?

c-1: ^I don't want to end up dead. Promise me this!

Promise: ^Good. Well, then, uh... mostly bad... [She blushes slightly]. Though it's complicated.

s: ^Ask her what's so bad about him.

Bad: ^He's, well... I do think he murdered his wife. I do think him capable of it. He stares off into the distance, mutters at nothing... sometimes he has this look about him that makes you think he's plotting your death...

^And he's terrible with money - he's an awful gambler, see, though he'd never admit it! And he kept asking me for money, at least when we were together- [She clamps a hand over her mouth, realizing she's said too much].

s: ^Ask what else makes her wary of Toby.

Violence: ^Well... Detective, you should have seen him the day I broke things off with him... if Mr. Willoughy hadn't been in the next room, he would have hurt me! I just know it...
^Maybe he killed Mr. Willoughby because he wanted to ruin my life...

s: ^What a terrible excuse for a man.
^Thank you for telling me. I'm glad you're okay.

c-0: ^Scum of the earth... I can't believe I was foolish enough to fall for him.
^I suppose guys like that can be charming...

c-1: ^[She smiles shakily]. You're awfully sweet, Detective. Though I'm not sure how okay I really am, considering I'm out of a job.

s: ^Tell her you can help with that.
^Do you want to go out sometime, after this, to forget all about it? (flirt)

c-0: ^Thanks, but I'll do fine on my own getting work anyway. Though perhaps I need to improve my typist skills first...
^Mr. Willoughby said they weren't quite up to snuff. I think he wanted to get rid of me over it. And no, before you ask, I wouldn't kill him for it either.

c-1: ^[She smiles beneath the tears]. I'd like some company. And I'll have the time, now that I have no job.

s: ^Say maybe you can help with that.

c-0: ^Oh, but I'd rather see you. I'll do fine on my own getting work anyway. Though perhaps I need to improve my typist skills first...
^Mr. Willoughby said they weren't quite up to snuff. I think he wanted to get rid of me over it. And no, before you ask, I wouldn't kill him for it either.

c-1: ^Thanks... I'm sure it will. [She seems genuine in that statement].

TobyDid: ^[She lowers her voice]. If I can be honest, Detective, I do think Toby killed my boss. Mr. Willoughby was getting higher with the fees and he was angry - calling on the phone about it all the time - and I think Mr. Willoughby was thinking of dropping the case, because he felt scummy defending him... at least I heard him telling Sam that.

s: ^I still have to hear all sides of the story.

c-1: ^Are you saying I'm lying? Please, Detective?

c-0: ^Well... you can keep a secret, right, Detective?

c-1: ^I don't want to end up dead. Promise me this!
